<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>ment; and admiration; but of the highest vertues they have</l>
            <l>no sense or 
              <choice>
                <sic>percebing</sic>
                <corr>perceiving</corr>
              </choice> at all."</l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The soul that walked between delicate groves, now</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and then formulating a 
            <choice>
              <sic>pharse</sic>
              <corr>phrase</corr>
            </choice> to be taken down by the 
            <choice>
              <sic>y ng</sic>
              <corr>young</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">secretary <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-thob" key="Hobbes, Thomas">Thomas Hobbes</rs>, kept to a narrow path between</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">hedges. While <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-mmon" key="Montaigne, Michel de">Montaigne</rs> ranged 
            <choice>
              <sic>th</sic>
              <corr>the</corr>
            </choice> world, 
            <choice>
              <sic>indulgn</sic>
              <corr>indulging</corr>
            </choice> all</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>curisoities</sic>
              <corr>curiosities</corr>
            </choice>, mixing 
            <choice>
              <sic>garrul usly</sic>
              <corr>garrulously</corr>
            </choice> with every one, Bacon kept</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to the narrow path. Yet even in the shade his thought</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is embodied. His deep meditations are given concrete form.</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>"Nay retire men 
              <choice>
                <sic>acnnot</sic>
                <corr>cannot</corr>
              </choice> when they would: neither will they</l>
            <l>when it were reason; but are 
              <choice>
                <sic>impateint</sic>
                <corr>impatient</corr>
              </choice> of privateness</l>
            <l>even in age and sickness which require the Shadow: Like old</l>
            <l>Townmen that will be still sitting at their street door,</l>
          </quote>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">though thereby they offer Age to scorn."</quote> Even in the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-gard" key="The Garden">green</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-gard">shade</rs> thought 
            <choice>
              <sic>ic</sic>
              <corr>is</corr>
            </choice> coloured. <quote source="#" rend="inline">The Colours that show best</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">by candlelight , are: White, Carnation, and a kinde of</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">Sea-Water Green".</quote> It only needs the playwright to put <add place="above">one push for their thoughts</add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">flesh and blood onto his thoughts. <add place="above">to become [people?]</add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Bacons contempt was for hyperbole; not for the art of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">speech. He was teaching the ranting players to speak</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">slowly, closely, subtly. He was proving that there is 
            <choice>
              <sic>anothe</sic>
              <corr>another</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">kind of poetry, the poetry of prose. He was bringing the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">prose of the mind into being. And thus by increasing the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">range of the poet, bu making it possible for him to express</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">more, he was making an end of anonymity.</l>
